data.title: 1943 – And the Runner
data.text:
The following is the average ranking of Oscar nominees by the Twitter followers of And the Runner-Up Is. Followers ranked the nominees of the above-the-line categories for the 16th Academy Awards, which rewarded the films of 1943.

Results are tallied using a positional voting system, where the nominees receive points based on their rank position on each submission and the nominee with the most points overall wins

Bold = the actual Academy Award winner

BEST PICTURE

Casablanca

The Ox-Bow Incident

The More the Merrier

Heaven Can Wait

The Song of Bernadette

Watch on the Rhine

The Human Comedy

In Which We Serve

Madame Curie

For Whom the Bell Tolls

BEST DIRECTOR

Michael Curtiz – Casablanca

George Stevens – The More the Merrier

Ernst Lubitsch – Heaven Can Wait

Henry King – The Song of Bernadette

Clarence Brown – The Human Comedy

BEST ACTOR

Humphrey Bogart – Casablanca

Paul Lukas – Watch on the Rhine

Mickey Rooney – The Human Comedy

Walter Pidgeon – Madame Curie

Gary Cooper – For Whom the Bell Tolls

BEST ACTRESS

Jean Arthur – The More the Merrier

Jennifer Jones – The Song of Bernadette

Greer Garson – Madame Curie

Joan Fontaine – The Constant Nymph

Ingrid Bergman – For Whom the Bell Tolls

BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR

Claude Rains – Casablanca

Charles Coburn – The More the Merrier

Charles Bickford – The Song of Bernadette

Akim Tamiroff – For Whom the Bell Tolls

J. Carrol Naish – Sahara

BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS

Gladys Cooper – The Song of Bernadette

Paulette Goddard – So Proudly We Hail!

Lucile Watson – Watch on the Rhine

Anne Revere – The Song of Bernadette

Katina Paxinou – For Whom the Bell Tolls

BEST ORIGINAL SCREENPLAY

In Which We Serve – Noel Coward

The North Star – Lillian Hellman

Princess O’Rourke – Norman Krasna

So Proudly We Hail! – Allan Scott

Air Force – Dudley Nichols

BEST ADAPTED SCREENPLAY
